componenttext: Welcome, everyone, to the Newfield Exploration First Quarter 2018 Earnings Conference Call. For opening remarks and other housekeeping items, I will turn the call over to Steve Campbell, Senior Vice President of Investor Relations.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thank you, operator, and good morning, everyone. Thanks for dialing in today for our call. Following today's prepared remarks by our Chairman and CEO, Lee Boothby, we will have multiple members of our management team here to take your questions. [Operator
componenttext:
Thank you, operator, and good morning, everyone. Thanks for dialing in today for our call. Following today's prepared remarks by our Chairman and CEO, Lee Boothby, we will have multiple members of our management team here to take your questions. [Operator Instructions] Let me also remind you that today's call is being recorded and will be available on our website, along with our earnings release, the financial tables and non-GAAP reconciliations and our @NFX Publication.
Today, we will reference certain non-GAAP measures, so please see the reconciliation in that earnings release and in @NFX.
Today's discussion will contain forward-looking estimates and assumptions based on our current views and reasonable expectations. In summary, statements in yesterday's news releases and @NFX presentation and on this conference call regarding our expectations or predictions of the future are forward-looking statements intended to be covered by the safe harbor provisions under federal securities laws. There are many factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from our expectations, including those we've described in the earnings release and @NFX, our 10-K and 10-Qs, our prior outlook release and other filings with the SEC. Please refer to the risk factors in our earnings release and @NFX for additional information.
Thanks again for dialing in. I'll now turn it over to Lee Boothby.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Good morning, everyone, and thanks for dialing in this morning. Last night, we published our financial and operating results for the first quarter and updated our guidance, along with additional color, in our @NFX Publication.Let's jump right in with a
componenttext:
Good morning, everyone, and thanks for dialing in this morning. Last night, we published our financial and operating results for the first quarter and updated our guidance, along with additional color, in our @NFX Publication.
Let's jump right in with a quick summary of our first quarter results. For the first quarter, both earnings and cash flow per share came in above Street estimates, and our production was at the upper end of guidance ranges. In short, we're off to a great start in 2018 and continue to have high confidence in our ability to deliver our 3-year business plan that we outlined for you in February.
Adjusting for unrealized derivative loss of $0.39 per diluted share, our net income for the quarter would have been $165 million or $0.82 per share. I would encourage you to see the explanation and reconciliation of non-GAAP financial measures at the end of our first quarter news release.
Our first quarter revenues benefited from higher production and stronger oil prices and were $580 million. Net cash provided by operating activities was $260 million, and discretionary cash flow from operations was $321 million. Our total net production in the first quarter was 176,500 barrels of oil equivalent per day, of which 42% was oil.
We obtained record net production for Newfield during the quarter and the Anadarko Basin. Our SCOOP and STACK net production averaged 117,500 barrels of oil equivalent per day, and we expect our development of these assets will yield rapid growth from here. Our plan estimates net production of as much as 200,000 barrels of oil equivalent per day in 2020. Anadarko Basin is the asset that will fuel our growth and transition us to living within cash flow from operations.
From a capital spending standpoint, we invested $345 million in the quarter, which was in line with our first quarter expectations. In the Anadarko Basin, our investment levels were slightly higher than planned related to higher-than-expected activity levels from outside operators and higher working interest through some of our HBP drilling efforts.
Activity levels in the Anadarko are very high today, but we are laser-focused on our investment levels and generating our 2018 growth outlook for $1.3 billion. Recall that this plan was based on an average oil price of $55 per barrel, and our cash flow will benefit from today's higher oil prices.
The execution of our business plan has us generating free cash within our planned period. Newfield has worked to transition our company to one that delivers strong growth and -- strong and consistent growth within cash flow from operations. We're on the cusp of this achievement today.
Let me cover a few of our recent highlights before moving to your questions. Domestic production was up 27% year-over-year, and our domestic oil production was up 29% year-over-year. Anadarko Basin production was up 34% year-over-year, and our realized oil price in STACK was 100% of NYMEX WTI. We continue to see strong demand for the STACK barrel as we sell directly into Cushing by pipeline. During the quarter, we turned 43 wells to sales in the Anadarko Basin, in line with our plan completion cadence. In STACK, we continue to benefit from the early and aggressive investments we made in infill drilling. Our 88 infill wells, including operated and non-operated pilots to date, have rapidly advanced our understanding of parent-child relationships and are shedding valuable light on how best to space and complete our pad developments to optimize future returns. We are leading in this regard. 
In today's @NFX, we've provided updated performance on 4 of our spacing tests between 6 and 12 wells per DSU in the Meramec only. So don't forget the other prolific horizons that will also get developed in the future. Our outlook for returns for each of these infill projects is very strong and highly encouraging. Of particular note is our Stark DSU, a 10-well development that has achieved payout in 12 months. The Williston Basin continues to perform extremely well. It's up nearly 10% year-over-year, as does the Uinta, which is up about 25% year-over-year. In the Williston, we are delivering some of the industry's most productive and cost-effective wells in the play. This is an important program for us as we expect it to deliver more than $100 million of free cash flow in 2018 at current oil prices.
Our offshore China production returned to sales, and we look to 261,000 barrels during the first quarter. Although our annual production in China is expected to average about 4,000 barrels of oil per day, our lifting schedule will vary each quarter. We expect to have 3 liftings in the second quarter, or about 750,000 barrels. There's additional guidance in @NFX to help you with the remainder of the year.
Our unsecured credit facility was upsized by $200 million with the addition of some new banking relationships, up to $2 billion total and extended out to mid-2023. This facility remains undrawn.
Again, we're off to a great start in 2018, and we are focused on delivering our 3-year plan, which we laid out for you in detail in February. Our plan has a careful balance of capital discipline, debt adjusted growth and production and cash flow and improving leverage metrics.
Thank you for your time today, and I look forward to updating you on our progress throughout the year. As always, we sincerely appreciate your investment in our company.
Operator, we're now ready for questions.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: [Operator Instructions] And we'll take our first question from Brian Singer with Goldman Sachs.
componenttext: [Operator Instructions] And we'll take our first question from Brian Singer with Goldman Sachs.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Can you further parse the better performance that you're seeing on the gas and NGL side in the Anadarko Basin between the strong results from the HBP wells in the western portion of the acreage versus more of the areas that will probably be the source of
componenttext: Can you further parse the better performance that you're seeing on the gas and NGL side in the Anadarko Basin between the strong results from the HBP wells in the western portion of the acreage versus more of the areas that will probably be the source of ongoing capital spending? And is it fair to say, and it may not, as we look at the outperformance versus your type curve from the Anadarko wells that, that outperformance is coming disproportionately from wet gas?

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: So there's a lot in there, Brian. I'm going to go ahead and say -- make a couple of comments, and then I'll let Gary shed some light. So if you look at the wells drilled in the release that are out in the far west area, you can see that we had a couple of
componenttext: So there's a lot in there, Brian. I'm going to go ahead and say -- make a couple of comments, and then I'll let Gary shed some light. So if you look at the wells drilled in the release that are out in the far west area, you can see that we had a couple of gassy wells, very low condensate yields, and a couple of higher condensate yield wells, all of which were very strong. As you move west through the acreage block that represents STACK and then STACK proper in terms of our footprint and those others that are investing, we've said consistently that you get gassier as you move out to the west. So this is consistent with the phase envelope understanding. We certainly have production coming from those wells as well as some OBO activity that's west of our primary position in STACK that also contributed to the gas in the first quarter. We don't have any plans to do additional drilling out in the western portion of the acreage. That was to secure HBP, those wells. There may be some ongoing OBO activity and, from time to time, a need to HBP some of that acreage. But we're pleased with the results. We've got solid returns there. Yields on NGLs out to the west are generally probably half of what we've seen in our primary SCOOP and STACK areas. But with those rates, obviously, still significant in terms of the total economic proposition. Processing, as well, in the first quarter has been favorable relative to the decision to process, and we've got those options embedded within our portfolio and agreements. So we make the decision month-to-month, and it's an economic decision, and we incorporated that into our forecast as well. So all of that has been embedded in the update.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Great. And then my follow-up relates to the 3-year plan that was recently updated, but just wanted to check in on, really, both the production side but also on the CapEx side, especially with higher oil prices, has certainly a benefit to revenues potentia
componenttext: Great. And then my follow-up relates to the 3-year plan that was recently updated, but just wanted to check in on, really, both the production side but also on the CapEx side, especially with higher oil prices, has certainly a benefit to revenues potentially here but also on potential cost pressures. Can you just talk to the pace of CapEx as we go forward to expect to achieve not just the 2018 plan but as you start to think about 2019.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Well, I think that the release stated pretty clearly, I think I made the comments as well in the prepared remarks, that we're still focused on a $1.3 billion CapEx plan for 2018. We certainly recognize that the commodity has come up, and that's certainly
componenttext: Well, I think that the release stated pretty clearly, I think I made the comments as well in the prepared remarks, that we're still focused on a $1.3 billion CapEx plan for 2018. We certainly recognize that the commodity has come up, and that's certainly beneficial. The curve, overall, is still backward-dated, and we've got a substantial hedge position in place for 2018. So I think that we've got a solid plan around those assumptions. We'll continue to monitor price. And sometime in the future, if the market conditions dictate, then we could consider a change. At this point, we're focused on our 3-year plan and delivering what we signed up for in February. As far as pressures on the cost side, we continue to see minimal inflation pressures in the Anadarko Basin. And CapEx spend has, likewise, been in line with expectations in that regard. Learning curve assumptions are built into the 3-year plan, and we're on track with the learning curves as well. So I think -- from an operating standpoint, I think the teams are executing extraordinarily well. I spent 2 days in the field a little over a week ago, in Oklahoma, and I can tell you that everybody I met, every man, woman that's deployed to manage and execute these programs is focused on cost and efficiencies. And that tells us that the goals that we've set have been communicated down where the rubber hits the road. I'm proud of them. They're going to execute and make good things happen on the road ahead.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: We'll now take our next question from Brad Heffern with RBC Capital Markets.
componenttext: We'll now take our next question from Brad Heffern with RBC Capital Markets.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Just starting off on the STACK. I was wondering if you could talk a little bit about where you guys feel like you're going to end up in terms of wells per section there. Obviously, you have a peer who has sort of settled on 8, but the Stark and the Velta
componenttext: Just starting off on the STACK. I was wondering if you could talk a little bit about where you guys feel like you're going to end up in terms of wells per section there. Obviously, you have a peer who has sort of settled on 8, but the Stark and the Velta June seem to have good results so far. So any thoughts around that?

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes. This is Gary. I think it's still far too early to really talk about this. As you already alluded to, Brad, we've seen some really good results to date. At the end of the day, it's all going to be about maximizing our net present value, which is going
componenttext: Yes. This is Gary. I think it's still far too early to really talk about this. As you already alluded to, Brad, we've seen some really good results to date. At the end of the day, it's all going to be about maximizing our net present value, which is going to be influenced by price, it's going to be influenced by our costs, and also the resource, and this is going to be vary across the play. As you've already alluded to, I think what we believe, certainly, we have detected, and we're on to some of the best techniques and designs to date. And I can reference just the last 4 projects, as you've seen. The Margies that we have online right now at 6 wells per DSU. The Rodenburg is at 8. And our most recent, the Starks and the Velta Junes are 10 and 12 wells per DSU. These projects are delivering over 90% returns. So -- and these are some of the fullest developed sections that we've seen to date and the most tightest. So I think this is not luck. I think from what's been reported, this is truly differentiating about some of the techniques that we're using. And at the end of the day, it's really all coming down to some of the targeting techniques we've used. We're optimizing our chemical treatments. We look at how we're -- our cluster spacing, how we're advancing some of the profit designs we have. It's pretty exciting, but I think it's still too early at this point to go ahead and identify what is the single spacing that we're on to.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Brad, I'll just add that we're focused on returns. The plays, or the projects that Gary referenced are all delivering high returns and returns in excess of the average that we've got embedded in the 3-year plan. Those are very, very encouraging results. I
componenttext: Brad, I'll just add that we're focused on returns. The plays, or the projects that Gary referenced are all delivering high returns and returns in excess of the average that we've got embedded in the 3-year plan. Those are very, very encouraging results. I said earlier that this is part of what gives us the confidence in driving the future growth in the Anadarko Basin is the results that are rolling off on these plays. And I can assure you, they are definitely not luck and not an accident. It's a result of a lot of good work by our team. We've been planning for development since the day we started out here. We set it up for development. The team invested aggressively in multi-well DSUs last year. Those are the results that are framing our decisions today on how to optimize this development on the road ahead, and some of those are contributing as well to the cost efficiencies that we're going to drive during the course of the 3-year plan.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Okay. I appreciate the detailed answer. And then, as my follow-up, the Uinta volumes were up pretty substantially this quarter. I don't think it had been up quite this much in several years. So can you talk about performance in that basin. And also, I was
componenttext: Okay. I appreciate the detailed answer. And then, as my follow-up, the Uinta volumes were up pretty substantially this quarter. I don't think it had been up quite this much in several years. So can you talk about performance in that basin. And also, I was wondering if you guys are facing any issues because of the refining downtime that Hoile has had?

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Well, certainly, we had some inventory builds with the refining downtime that Hoile had. I think we had communicated that previously, but it didn't impact our operations. We were able to put the barrels into inventory and then move the barrels out when th
componenttext: Well, certainly, we had some inventory builds with the refining downtime that Hoile had. I think we had communicated that previously, but it didn't impact our operations. We were able to put the barrels into inventory and then move the barrels out when the refinery got back online. So I think that's going well. As far as the Uinta basin, we put a slide out in February. I think you can see that the team's been drilling some really strong wells. Our focus in '18 is to HBP about 10,000 acres in the heart of that play. The well results that you're seeing and the production are a result of that drilling program. Simply that.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: We'll now take our next question from Dave Kistler with Piper Jaffray.
componenttext: We'll now take our next question from Dave Kistler with Piper Jaffray.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: So I guess, kind of real simplistically, I'm looking at the guide, and production is higher, CapEx is unchanged, domestic oil growth also unchanged, but oil growth outperformed in 1Q. Are -- and I'm not trying to lead the witness, but are we being conserv
componenttext: So I guess, kind of real simplistically, I'm looking at the guide, and production is higher, CapEx is unchanged, domestic oil growth also unchanged, but oil growth outperformed in 1Q. Are -- and I'm not trying to lead the witness, but are we being conservative while we wait to see how some of these wells continue to hang in? As you highlighted on the infill pilots and whatnot, they're performing above type curves. I'm just trying to get my head around that. And then maybe even more simplistically, with flat CapEx, higher production, capital efficiency should be improving. Am I missing something there?

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: No, I don't think you're missing anything, Dave. I think the DSUs that I referenced earlier, where we have substantial performance to date are all performing extraordinarily well. The fact that you're running on those slightly above the 1.3 million barrel
componenttext: No, I don't think you're missing anything, Dave. I think the DSUs that I referenced earlier, where we have substantial performance to date are all performing extraordinarily well. The fact that you're running on those slightly above the 1.3 million barrel average that we embedded in the 3-year plan, that should be encouraging to everybody. But I'm -- I'll remind everyone that it's still early innings. You can see in the @NFX Publication, we've got additional pilots as we continue to spread out across the primary STACK footprint. My expectation is we'll continue to deliver strong results there and further derisk the plan forecast looking forward. I think all of that's positive. The fact that we're on track with regard to our efficiency gains coming into this year, I think, is positive as well. And the fact that we're not seeing the type of inflationary pressures that we suffered through last year is also a positive. At the end of the day, a lot of work went into that 3-year plan. I think our team has been consistently right in terms of how it's forecast and how it's predicted the play was going to evolve. We did take a position in terms of not driving the type curve up. When we're in HBP mode, I'm counseling people that when you get into development mode that -- and the wells have neighbors, you need to be thinking about that. I think these results demonstrate that our team was embedding that all the way along. I think most importantly, Dave, at the end of the day, it comes down to this. Good plays tend to get better over time. Great teams tend to make great plays even better. And that's what our team has done. That's what we're going to do. I think I'll reference the Bakken as the most recent example. But I think in each play that we've deployed capital and talent, our team has managed to exceed expectations.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: I appreciate that color. And maybe one for either you or Larry. Expansion of the bank facility, obviously, kind of highlights at least the lender's confidence in the underlying assets and operations. Unsecured facility, again, reinforces that. But just tr
componenttext: I appreciate that color. And maybe one for either you or Larry. Expansion of the bank facility, obviously, kind of highlights at least the lender's confidence in the underlying assets and operations. Unsecured facility, again, reinforces that. But just trying to get my hands around why we'd want to expand the facility or grow the facility. Is it maybe for temporal use of retiring debt longer term, or refinancing debt longer term? Just trying to understand -- well, what's the benefit...

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Well, Dave, since you gave me the option to slide it over to Larry, I'm going to flip that one over to Larry and let Larry give you some color on that.
componenttext: Well, Dave, since you gave me the option to slide it over to Larry, I'm going to flip that one over to Larry and let Larry give you some color on that.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes. Dave, the facility, upsizing it to the $200 million, there's couple of factors that went into it. One, we brought in a few new banks, and that creates some room for them. Two, it creates a little bit more optionality and flexibility for us in the fut
componenttext: Yes. Dave, the facility, upsizing it to the $200 million, there's couple of factors that went into it. One, we brought in a few new banks, and that creates some room for them. Two, it creates a little bit more optionality and flexibility for us in the future. You noted that we might want to take out some bonds going forward, it depends on where we sit down the road, but that certainly gives us a little bit more headroom in that. And I think just upsizing the facility, now, you have to kind of plan 5 years out on what the company's going to look at -- look like, and we look at our growth rate, both in the production and cash flow, we expect to have greater needs possibly. And so I think it was a really smart thing to do. We took advantage of a great market getting an unsecured facility and kind of renewing what we had and enlarging it, and it was really smart, and we're very happy with it.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: And Dave, I'll add that I'm really proud of our team. I think they did good work here, and it was well planned and well executed and a good piece of work in my mind.
componenttext: And Dave, I'll add that I'm really proud of our team. I think they did good work here, and it was well planned and well executed and a good piece of work in my mind.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: [Operator Instructions] And we'll take our next question from Neal Dingmann with SunTrust.
componenttext: [Operator Instructions] And we'll take our next question from Neal Dingmann with SunTrust.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Lee, for you or Gary, just wondering on -- you had mentioned kind of the learning curve now that you've gone down and you guys are in development mode. Can you talk about, with just the choke management, where you guys sort of sit now? Would that plus jus
componenttext: Lee, for you or Gary, just wondering on -- you had mentioned kind of the learning curve now that you've gone down and you guys are in development mode. Can you talk about, with just the choke management, where you guys sort of sit now? Would that plus just the amount of proppant that you're using kind of if you think you kind of hit that sort of ultimate target on each?

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes. Let me -- I'll just give you a quick high level, and then I'll pass it over to Gary, and he can give you some of the color. I think one of the things that I've really been pleased with in terms of our team is as they've evaluated the data over the la
componenttext: Yes. Let me -- I'll just give you a quick high level, and then I'll pass it over to Gary, and he can give you some of the color. I think one of the things that I've really been pleased with in terms of our team is as they've evaluated the data over the last couple of years, that's our data and all of the data operated by others, we've been working that into our game plan on these DSUs. When we drilled the multi-well DSUs, high-density DSUs that were executed last year, one of the flags that they had put up was that there seemed to be detrimental effects in some of the big wells that were drilled in the HBP mode in and around some areas where we had drilled some pretty good wells. And you generally would think that, that's phase-related. So they came up with a strategy where they're managing chokes and pressures, but you can think about it as managing pressure distribution and the reservoir system. And it appears to be paying really good dividends. We're seeing consistent sustained performance there. So I think that's a good product of the technical team, asset team doing a really, really good technical work. We also, in that same vein, did a lot of testing on proppant and fluid loading. In HBP mode, clearly, it was demonstrated that -- by ourselves and the industry that more fluid, more proppant, bigger well. I think we counseled consistently that, that didn't mean that the most proppant and the most fluid was the best well to drill in development mode. And so we've taken a different tack there. And I'll flip it over to Gary. He can give you some color of the operations on the ground.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes. As far as the dry-down, controlled flowbacks, it's a practice that we're employing on all of our DSUs consistently, and we think that is leading to better performance. As Lee suggested, what we've learned in the Velta June, where we've actually exper
componenttext: Yes. As far as the dry-down, controlled flowbacks, it's a practice that we're employing on all of our DSUs consistently, and we think that is leading to better performance. As Lee suggested, what we've learned in the Velta June, where we've actually experimented with many different proppant fluid loadings, we've learned a lot from that. I would tell you we're testing some slightly less intense fracs out there today, and we're monitoring their performance and see if that's an opportunity where, basically, we can continue to become more capitally efficient and drive F&D and not materially, if at all, even affect the type curve. So we think there's some opportunities here, but it's really still early at this point to say that we've defined what the optimum is.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: No, it makes sense, guys. And then -- go ahead, Lee.
componenttext: No, it makes sense, guys. And then -- go ahead, Lee.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: I was going to just add one other thing as, obviously, part of the team, but, I mean, when you think about all the variables they're working with, that's a critical one that you flagged. But they're managing through all kinds of other items. It takes kind
componenttext: I was going to just add one other thing as, obviously, part of the team, but, I mean, when you think about all the variables they're working with, that's a critical one that you flagged. But they're managing through all kinds of other items. It takes kind of the multidisciplinary approach teamwork to get there. But frac order, the well layout, optimal geological targets, smooth wellbores, parent well mitigation, flowback practices, we're talking about flowback practices, but all of those other elements are important, too. So when you look back at our DSUs that we've put out, pay close attention to the geometry. And when you guys start comparing DSUs, when you're looking at data across multiple companies, keep in touch with the geometry. Geometry is going to be an important part of the mix in the end of the day. So...

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Great. Great point. And then, Lee, one other. Just your opinion here. It seems to me there's still investor -- just misunderstanding. I mean, again, I look at just this last quarter, I thought you guys not only hit it right down the middle; you hit it a h
componenttext: Great. Great point. And then, Lee, one other. Just your opinion here. It seems to me there's still investor -- just misunderstanding. I mean, again, I look at just this last quarter, I thought you guys not only hit it right down the middle; you hit it a hell of a long ways, and yet investors don't seem to be agreeing. I'm just wondering, from your side, I know there's theories out there. I'm just wondering from your side if there's something that sticks out, what you think is certainly misunderstood as judged by, which I thought were exceptional results today?

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thanks for the recognition of the results that the team delivered. We think they're strong results as well, and I think it gives great confidence in executing the 3-year plan that we signed up for in February. When it comes down to it, we've got to focus
componenttext: Thanks for the recognition of the results that the team delivered. We think they're strong results as well, and I think it gives great confidence in executing the 3-year plan that we signed up for in February. When it comes down to it, we've got to focus on execution. We've got to focus on delivering the results, and the market will sort itself out over time. I think there's been a lot of noise, and I guess you would say that some of the noise within the basin over the course of the last quarter created some headwinds. But yes, I could go back to last quarter and say that we met or exceeded all of the expectations in that quarter as well. So I think we're executing very well. I think we continue to execute our plan, and my bet is that people will get comfortable as we continue to roll off successful multi-well DSUs, and the growth that we've got programmed is delivered.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: We'll take our next question from Michael Cross from SouthernSun Asset Management.
componenttext: We'll take our next question from Michael Cross from SouthernSun Asset Management.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: I was wondering if you could comment on the free cash flow comment that you made back in February, where I think you said potentially $1 billion in free cash flow generated at $60 oil and $3 gas. And if you could provide any update there.
componenttext: I was wondering if you could comment on the free cash flow comment that you made back in February, where I think you said potentially $1 billion in free cash flow generated at $60 oil and $3 gas. And if you could provide any update there.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes. So I think to take us back to that time, we showed 2 cases in February. They were -- assumptions that are well documented in the materials that were put out at that time. We ran a $55 flat case and a $60 flat case, so it wasn't a backward dated look.
componenttext: Yes. So I think to take us back to that time, we showed 2 cases in February. They were -- assumptions that are well documented in the materials that were put out at that time. We ran a $55 flat case and a $60 flat case, so it wasn't a backward dated look. But at $55, it's $300 million-plus free cash flow over the 3-year plan period. And at $60-plus, it was $1 billion. And so those were the assumptions that are embedded in the plan. Ultimately, the product of all the things that we've been talking about this morning, including price, the actual final price path, will determine the final outcome. But as far as the trajectory, I would say that from an operating standpoint, we're still strong. I think the challenge for us is to overcome the tax adjustment that was flagged here in February. And we think price is going a long ways towards helping that in that regard. So I'd say taxes in the first quarter prospectively are a headwind relative to the planned, and oil is a tailwind. As we think about it, we think everything is working to where we'll be able to offset that in the course of the 3-year plan period.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: [Operator Instructions] And we'll take our next question from Ron Mills with Johnson Rice.
componenttext: [Operator Instructions] And we'll take our next question from Ron Mills with Johnson Rice.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Maybe for Gary. Just as we look at the infill projects from the @NFX presentation, can you talk a little bit about the Jackson/Florene results versus the Stark and Velta June and the vintage of those? Were you able to apply information from Jackson or --
componenttext: Maybe for Gary. Just as we look at the infill projects from the @NFX presentation, can you talk a little bit about the Jackson/Florene results versus the Stark and Velta June and the vintage of those? Were you able to apply information from Jackson or -- and Florene into some of these -- the other pilots that are clearly tracking well ahead of the 1.3 million barrel curve?

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Sure. The Jackson and the Florenes are a little further east. They're out into the area that there was a lot of discussion on the last quarter's call. Really great results. These particular ones have 4 in the Upper Meramec section. But the exciting thing
componenttext: Sure. The Jackson and the Florenes are a little further east. They're out into the area that there was a lot of discussion on the last quarter's call. Really great results. These particular ones have 4 in the Upper Meramec section. But the exciting thing about this particular one is that it was actually developed over the top of 2 Woodford wells. So it was the -- one of our first really codeveloped areas. And ultimately, we're sitting at an effective 6 wells per Meramec based on the spacing that was included. We applied all learnings that we had, had from the Velta June. And this is, at the end of the day, those -- what we got from the Jackson and the Florenes were ultimately applied in the Margies, where we're sitting at 6 wells and really like the results that we're seeing out of the Margies thus far. So, in essence, we're just building -- each one of these DSUs, we build on the results from the prior one and apply the learnings, and I think we have a good trajectory of that right now.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Great. And then as it relates to -- you highlighted the -- not just your oil pricing with the impact from Anadarko and the Williston Basin but also on the gas side. What drove -- what's driving that increased gas price realization? Is it on the gathering
componenttext: Great. And then as it relates to -- you highlighted the -- not just your oil pricing with the impact from Anadarko and the Williston Basin but also on the gas side. What drove -- what's driving that increased gas price realization? Is it on the gathering side? Is it with takeaway? With Enable? And how much of that -- is that expected to continue given the planned growth over the next 2 to 3 years?

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes. I'll let Larry give some color on that. He's been involved with helping us get the agreements in place that we've talked about over the course of the last year, 1.5 years, and I think he can give you some good color there.
componenttext: Yes. I'll let Larry give some color on that. He's been involved with helping us get the agreements in place that we've talked about over the course of the last year, 1.5 years, and I think he can give you some good color there.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes, as far as the natural gas takeaway, it's primarily driven by the Enable transportation agreement, when you look at that. We saw a couple of years ago the possibility that we'd see kind of basis issues forming not only in the Anadarko but in other bas
componenttext: Yes, as far as the natural gas takeaway, it's primarily driven by the Enable transportation agreement, when you look at that. We saw a couple of years ago the possibility that we'd see kind of basis issues forming not only in the Anadarko but in other basins. And so we made moves ahead of that to get our gas out of the basin priced into the southeast. And when you look at that, by the end of this year in October, we'll have another 160 million, bringing us to 205 million cubic feet a day on Enable. That -- along with about 70 million cubic feet that's going to the Midwest, will take 2/3 of our gas out of the basin, and we have both those contracts in place. We have some physical hedges that's going to advantage us over the next few years. So when you look at Newfield, we've had a great run this quarter comparing our [ diffs ] to that of our competitors. When you look out 2019 and 2020, we'll continue to have some advantage. Although that'll pull down a little bit as some of the fiscal hedges for a while.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes. And I'll just add that, again, credit to our team. I think the -- it was one of the greatest risks that we saw back in '16, '17, looking out into '18 and '19 time period. I think we moved early to lift that risk, and I think it proves today it serves
componenttext: Yes. And I'll just add that, again, credit to our team. I think the -- it was one of the greatest risks that we saw back in '16, '17, looking out into '18 and '19 time period. I think we moved early to lift that risk, and I think it proves today it serves our shareholders well. So I think good piece of work.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: We'll take our next question from Derrick Whitfield with Stifel Financial.
componenttext: We'll take our next question from Derrick Whitfield with Stifel Financial.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Lee, as a build on a previous question, I'd agree that you guys generally printed a strong quarter across the board. The only perceived weakness was you didn't raise the oil outlook in the Anadarko, and that seems to be the area of contention this morning
componenttext: Lee, as a build on a previous question, I'd agree that you guys generally printed a strong quarter across the board. The only perceived weakness was you didn't raise the oil outlook in the Anadarko, and that seems to be the area of contention this morning. We've extensively reviewed your STACK type curves with a focus on oil volumes and generally come to the same conclusion you do on Page 6. What more can you say to investors to provide them confidence in your Anadarko oil growth into 2019?

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Well, I think that we signed up for the 3-year plan that we put forth, and we take our commitment in that regard serious. And we're not trying to be used car salesmen here. I think that we've taken a prudent approach. I think that, as I mentioned earlier,
componenttext: Well, I think that we signed up for the 3-year plan that we put forth, and we take our commitment in that regard serious. And we're not trying to be used car salesmen here. I think that we've taken a prudent approach. I think that, as I mentioned earlier, the plan as constructed is a careful balance of all of the things that we divined from lots of meetings with better than 50% of our ownership during the course of the 12 months preceding the plan. So in our view, we're focused on returns. It is a mix. So we think it's a thoughtful mix of understanding what the investors demand and want today. We want to demonstrate capital discipline, strong returns, debt adjusted production and cash flow growth that I referenced. And I'll say again, I think I said it in February, it's the right plan for NFX, and we're committed to delivering it. So we've got a long track record in that regard. It's something we take seriously. We're going to work every day, to give you some color. I guarantee you, every man and woman at Newfield listening to this call right now, they show up every day to beat the plan. And this magic that they create doesn't just happen, okay? They've got to do lots of little things. It's little wins that get -- that take place day by day, hour by hour. I'll never bet against them, and I'm going to advise everybody outside not to bet against them. We're going to deliver this plan, and we'll find ways to optimize it over time. No doubt about that. And I think the other thing I would say is keep your eye on the ball. 2020, we're signed up for 200,000 BOE per day of production coming out of the Anadarko Basin. And it's a really, really strong growth trajectory there, and a lot of superlative execution has to take place to delivery it.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: As a follow-up on one of the last comments you made with regard to the 3-year outlook, to what degree can you reallocate capital to your oilier STACK acreage in light of the current higher oil price environment we're in?
componenttext: As a follow-up on one of the last comments you made with regard to the 3-year outlook, to what degree can you reallocate capital to your oilier STACK acreage in light of the current higher oil price environment we're in?

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Well, you have to think about all of the other dynamics that take place in these plays, and I think I may have counseled that every play is going to face these things. So there's lots of activity going on. If we were the only company playing in the STACK
componenttext: Well, you have to think about all of the other dynamics that take place in these plays, and I think I may have counseled that every play is going to face these things. So there's lots of activity going on. If we were the only company playing in the STACK play and you had infinite approvals, and you didn't have to do all the things you do to get regulatory approval to drill, you could turn on a dime. But the fact of the matter is the team has to stay in touch with offset operators, you've got to manage for frac bashing and things that occur in that regard. I think that's worked extraordinarily well amongst the operators in the Anadarko. But every other play is going to face some of those same challenges kind of on the road ahead. I think the other item is that we're HBP, so we're in a good place there. So we're moving away from primarily in HBP mode through 2017 for the most part into pure development as you get to 2019 forward. And I think at that point, all of the data that we've gathered, all of the information that you've analyzed and put together all comes together to give you high certainty, high confidence in that forward plan. We are high-grading -- are high-grading to drill the best highest returns. We make adjustments real time during the course of the year. So to the extent that the team is able to take advantage of learnings and shift capital, they do it, and they'll continue to do that through the course of the plan period. Our focus today is continue to high-grade, make sure we get the highest return opportunities at the front of the line, get the final HBP push behind us and keep our eye on the ball of getting to free cash flow generation as quickly as possible.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: We'll take our next question from Leo Mariani with NatAlliance Securities.
componenttext: We'll take our next question from Leo Mariani with NatAlliance Securities.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: I just wanted to shift gears a little bit to the Bakken. I guess, obviously, an area that didn't get as much focus here in the slide deck. Just curious as to what you're seeing in well performance, if the wells are consistent, if you're continuing to see
componenttext: I just wanted to shift gears a little bit to the Bakken. I guess, obviously, an area that didn't get as much focus here in the slide deck. Just curious as to what you're seeing in well performance, if the wells are consistent, if you're continuing to see better results there. And then additionally, are you experiencing any issues out there in the basin? I know that there are some problems with gas processing and takeaway basin-wide. I just wanted to see if NFX is impacted.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes. Leo, results in the Bakken continue to impress both on the Nesson Anticline and off the Anticline. Everything has responded very, very well to the increased proppant densities and fluid densities, and I really like the results that we continue to ach
componenttext: Yes. Leo, results in the Bakken continue to impress both on the Nesson Anticline and off the Anticline. Everything has responded very, very well to the increased proppant densities and fluid densities, and I really like the results that we continue to achieve there. And a lot of them are being achieved not only in the drilling within the Bakken itself, but the team has done a great job in threading additional Three Forks wells in both the First and Second benches, and they continue to impress. What you asked about as far as there are constraints developing in the basin. I think they've been widely reported. The -- it looks like we may have some relief on the flaring side. These are all things that we've got baked into our plans. These -- many of these things have already been anticipated. But the fact of the matter remains -- the Bakken remains some of the best returns, most productive wells that we have in just about anybody's portfolio, at a million barrel EURs, and these wells are being drilled in, oftentimes, less than $6 million. It has had a great place in our portfolio, and it continues to define greater confidence that we have in our plan coming out of the basin.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: And I think, Leo, I had referenced earlier a focus on generating a free cash flow composite. The $100 million-plus in the current price environment for the Williston Basin this year, 1-rig program, we've used this asset to kind of lead the way on some of
componenttext: And I think, Leo, I had referenced earlier a focus on generating a free cash flow composite. The $100 million-plus in the current price environment for the Williston Basin this year, 1-rig program, we've used this asset to kind of lead the way on some of the innovations that we're applying today in SCOOP and STACK. I think that's been a positive attribute as well. And clearly, were the bottleneck to develop, we can shift capital out of the Williston Basin into the SCOOP and STACK plays. That would be the response if it were to effect Newfield in terms of production.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Okay. That's helpful for sure. And then, I guess, just as a follow-up, you folks obviously highlighted 4 wells on the western side in the STACK play here in the first quarter, and you gave some detail around those. I guess, you talked about 43 total compl
componenttext: Okay. That's helpful for sure. And then, I guess, just as a follow-up, you folks obviously highlighted 4 wells on the western side in the STACK play here in the first quarter, and you gave some detail around those. I guess, you talked about 43 total completions, so obviously, a ton of other wells out there. Just curious as to kind of where the activity has been focused. Are you kind of more focused in the central part of your acreage block or the east side or just kind of all over? Just trying to get a sense of if the activity is going to be shifting towards some oilier areas just later in the year. Maybe just kind of talk about the development plan this year.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes, so I'll take the first part of that, and then if I leave anything, Gary can jump in and piggyback. So the wells out to the west, the HBP wells, that's protecting acreage that came to us with the Chesapeake acquisition back in 2016. So we've -- it's b
componenttext: Yes, so I'll take the first part of that, and then if I leave anything, Gary can jump in and piggyback. So the wells out to the west, the HBP wells, that's protecting acreage that came to us with the Chesapeake acquisition back in 2016. So we've -- it's been a good acquisition for us. The lease term is such that it was time to drill and HBP those leases. So that's really what the focus was on the 4 wells that we put forth. There's been some other OBO activity out in that area, and I suspect it's largely related to the same activity, that people have HBP-ed acreage footprints, which is preserving an option, a value option for the future. And we don't plan to develop, follow-up on any of these at this stage in development mode. If you look at the slide that you referenced, the area just north of that, which is kind of the area we call the Northwest STACK, that's the one remaining area in the STACK play that we've got some HBP activity ongoing, results of the SCORE initiative that we had last year. So the Northwest STACK extension is turning out to be a really, really strong positive, and we're drilling some exciting wells in there right now. So we'll get that acreage HBP-ed. So that's something that is a portion of the capital this year that's not committed directly to development. It's a good economic decision, and those wells are -- those returns are competitive with the other investments we're making out there. So we feel really good about that. Beyond that, you come back to STACK proper, or Eastern acreage footprint, and you can kind of see, when you look at where we've spaced out the pilots, that we get finish with the next 3 that we've got in line, we'll have drilled multi-well DSUs in the Meramec across a substantive footprint in that eastern STACK acreage block. That is what sets up the development drilling in the 3-year plan. So I think that's where most all of the activity is focused in STACK. And certainly, that activity will grow in '19 and '20 as we go into full development mode. And then of course, we do have some activity down in the SCOOP play as well, and a portion of that is tied to North SCOOP where we've got one rig running, and that's cleaning up on some HBP activity there, similar to what we've done out west. We'll get that largely behind us this year, and then that'll become part of the development inventory for the future. And then down in SCOOP, that's development at this stage. We're focused on developing Woodford. So most of the capital going to development, but those 2 areas kind of give you some color of the pressures that the team face day to day. And I think they're making good decisions. And again, when you're drilling strong economic results on HBP mode, it's never a bad thing. We'll take it.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: We have time for one last question, and we'll take our last question from Marshall Carver with Heikkinen Energy Advisors.
componenttext: We have time for one last question, and we'll take our last question from Marshall Carver with Heikkinen Energy Advisors.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: You had big growth in the Uinta Basin, putting 7 wells online. I was surprised at how much growth that generated. Just wanted to see if you were surprised too, and that was a -- if those results were in line with your expectations or better. And also, as
componenttext: You had big growth in the Uinta Basin, putting 7 wells online. I was surprised at how much growth that generated. Just wanted to see if you were surprised too, and that was a -- if those results were in line with your expectations or better. And also, as a follow-on to that, your plan for the year, it looks like you're planning on doing 10 to 15 wells, and 7 of those were in 1Q. With those results -- with those kinds of results, would you be inclined to...

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: No surprises there.
componenttext: No surprises there.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Okay, so no surprises. So no -- would you...
componenttext: Okay, so no surprises. So no -- would you...

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: No surprises, no surprises here. We executed the JV program. We've led the way on horizontal drilling out there. We've got our acreage largely HBP-ed. We talked about it in February. You guys could look at the results. The well results are strong. The cos
componenttext: No surprises, no surprises here. We executed the JV program. We've led the way on horizontal drilling out there. We've got our acreage largely HBP-ed. We talked about it in February. You guys could look at the results. The well results are strong. The costs of performance is outstanding. Returns are good. So I would say what it gives you is it gives you a little bit of a look as to how that asset can be part of driving the future for the company. But the program this year is based on HBP. We're going to HBP about 10,000 acres in the central portion of that footprint, and it's a good economic decision. And that's it.

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: Heading forward from here, do you think with those additional wells -- what would the production look like in that basin? Should that decline in 2Q because you got a bunch of extra wells on in 1Q? Or will the additional wells keep it flat? Or how should w
componenttext: Heading forward from here, do you think with those additional wells -- what would the production look like in that basin? Should that decline in 2Q because you got a bunch of extra wells on in 1Q? Or will the additional wells keep it flat? Or how should we think about that?

headline: Newfield Exploration Company, Q1 2018 Earnings Call, May 02, 2018
componenttextpreview: We've got one rig running throughout through November, I believe is the time period. And so you'll have another normal cadence of turnover on the production. So at this point, I'd just go ahead and say it's embedded in our plan. It's a great option for th
componenttext: We've got one rig running throughout through November, I believe is the time period. And so you'll have another normal cadence of turnover on the production. So at this point, I'd just go ahead and say it's embedded in our plan. It's a great option for the future for our owners, and we're getting it a held by production, and we'll tell you more about it at the right place and time. But right now, we're focused on the 3-year plan and executing against that, and we've got strong performance there as well.
